body: R: @dhalperi
R: @jbonofre
What's the rationale for this upgrade ?

The rational is that for maven plugins we can benefit of the latest fixes with really low risk. Version 2.20 fixes many issues:
https://maven.apache.org/surefire/maven-surefire-plugin/jira-report.html
And additionally supports colored output for users of the latest version of Maven.
Also notice that the version of the plugin has been moved into a property to avoid the possible issue with different versions of the plugin.

R: @dhalperi @kennknowles

> Done. So, private methods should not be be defined in pxd files ?

The distinction is that only modified methods (or classes) need to be defined in pxd files (e.g. designating that this is a cdef, rather than def, method, and typing its parameters). These validate methods are not performance critical, so leaving them as "ordinary" methods is fine (and less verbose).
LGTM but any context on why it was separate? Just legacy? AvroCoder?
I believe there used to be a dependency from Dataflow worker. (Service BigQueryIO.read with avro).

Changes Unknown when pulling **876f6215c6093d203df81e34d1af4f1b43c54d58 on kennknowles:Flink-WindowedWordCountIT** into ** on apache:master**.

This is a good thing to bring up on dev@beam.apache.org so that the whole community can be part of the conversation. I'm sure everyone will be interested in how you use the `Sink` design pattern.

I will give a quick answer right here: `Write.to(Sink)` was never a primitive but just a design pattern. The design pattern did not work correctly with unbounded data, windowing, or triggers. We found many connectors where it just wasn't the right design anyhow. And when it _was_ used, most of its capabilities were left blank most of the time. So we decided to inline it and do only the parts needed for different IO connectors.

The recommendation now is to build the composite transform directly. You may notice that most of the IO connectors in the Beam codebase never used `Sink`, because it just was not helpful. There is a longer IO authoring guide at https://beam.apache.org/documentation/io/authoring-overview/, which still needs update for this change.
I see. Thanks for the explanation.
